alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Newport News; Northumberland; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex, southeastern Northumberland, York, Mathews, central James City and southeastern Lancaster Counties, the north central City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 445 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Deltaville to near Gwynn to near Mathews to College Of William And Mary. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, Kilmarnock, Queens Lake, Fair Port, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Norge, Deltaville, Gloucester Point, College Of William And Mary, Seaford, White Stone, Busch Gardens, Hayes, Carver Gardens, Tabb, Kings Point and Gwynn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Newport News; Northumberland; York
